lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
To build for local development on macOS:
# bazel makes a wrapper script around the jar file.
To build jar file for deployment purposes:
`pre-commit` is a python tool that helps to create git pre-commit hook handlers. For this project, it is used to enforce Google Java Style (via `google-java-format`) on new commits.
To setup, ensure you have [`pre-commit`](https://pre-commit.com/#install) installed, then run:
This only needs to be executed once, so that `pre-commit` can generate the script and write it to `.git/hooks/pre-commit`
Thereafter, it should be executed right before every commit!

public final class TerminalUI implements UI {
private static Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);
s = Arrays.stream(s.split("\n")).map(x -> "\t" + x).reduce("", (x, y) -> x + y + "\n");
private final ByteArrayOutputStream out = new ByteArrayOutputStream();

new ByteArrayInputStream("todo read book
todo return book
list
bye".getBytes());
assertTrue("it adds the 1st item", output.contains("Now you have 1 tasks in the list"));
assertTrue("it adds the 2nd item", output.contains("Now you have 2 tasks in the list"));
assertTrue("it lists the items", output.contains("1.[T][ ] read book"));
assertTrue("it lists the items", output.contains("2.[T][ ] return book"));
assertTrue("it exits", output.contains("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!"));
assertTrue(res.getText().contains("Nice! I've marked this task as done"));
assertTrue(res.getText().contains("Item 10000 is not on the list. I cannot mark it as done!"));
assertEquals("has correct number of items", 2, list.size());
assertEquals("can mark tasks as done", "learn bazel", task.getDescription());
assertTrue("task is set to done", task.isDone());
TodoTask task = new TodoTask("learn java well");
